</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> This command will execute attached code whenever a player is connected to a MP session. The code will receive a number of special variables:
* '''_id''': [[Number]] - is the unique DirectPlay ID. Quite useless as the number is too big for in-built string representation and gets rounded. It is also the same id used for user placed markers.
* '''_uid''': [[String]] - is [[getPlayerUID]] of the joining player. In Arma 3 it is also the same as Steam ID.
* '''_name''': [[String]] - is [[profileName]] of the joining player.
* '''_jip''': (''since Arma 3 v1.49'') [[Boolean]] - is a flag that indicates whether or not the player joined after the mission has started ('''J'''oined '''I'''n '''P'''rogress). [[true]] when the player is [[JIP]], otherwise [[false]].
* '''_owner''': (''since Arma 3 v1.49'') [[Number]] - is [[owner]] id of the joining player. Can be used for kick or ban purposes or just for [[publicVariableClient]].
* '''_idstr''': (''since Arma 3 v1.95'') [[String]] - same as <tt>_id</tt> but in string format, so could be exactly compared to [[allMapMarkers | user marker]] ids.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3 </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Since '''Arma 3''' ''v1.57'' a stackable MissionEventHandler is available and should be used: [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PlayerConnected|PlayerConnected]].<br>
Before that, the functions [[BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler]] and [[BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler]] should be used instead in order to keep compatibility between official and community content.</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[onPlayerConnected]] code </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> code: [[String]] or [[Code]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[onPlayerConnected]] "[_id, _name] [[execVM]] ""PlayerConnected.sqf""";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[onPlayerConnected]] { [[diag_log]] [_id, _uid, _name] };</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> From '''<template><title>arma3</title></template>''' v1.49:
<code>[[onPlayerConnected]] {
	somevar = [[random]] 123;
	_owner [[publicVariableClient]] "somevar";
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>this will set somevar</value></part></template>
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>joining player PC to a random value</value></part></template>
};</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> From '''<template><title>arma3</title></template>''' v1.49:
<code>[[onPlayerConnected]] { isJip = _jip; _owner [[publicVariableClient]] "isJip" };
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Each player will now have variable isJip containing individual JIP info</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> The ''statement'' is executed only on the server, not on the joining player's computer, nor on any other client.<br>
This happens even if '''onPlayerConnected''' was issued on all machines. <br>
Note that there is a player with the '''_name''' called __SERVER__ which will also connect to a multiplayer game, executing ''code''. </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer</name>=<value>
